data.title: Top 10 famous bald NBA players of all time (with pictures)
data.meta_description: Coincidentally or not, the most famous bald NBA players are among the greatest men to be on the pitch. Who are they? Here is more about them and their pictures.
data.text:
When it comes to being the best basketball player, commitment, physique, determination, and resilience differentiate great players from the rest. But could baldness help one become a great player? No. However, one thing worth mentioning is that the crème de la crèmes have one thing in common, baldness. So, who are the most famous bald NBA players of all time?

Many NBA players love to rock bald heads proudly. Some do it by choice, while others are nothing of victims of their genetics. But, coincidentally or not, some of the best NBA players of all time are bald. For this reason, many basketball fans believe bald NBA players are the best and among the most talented.

Bald NBA players

Some of the best National Basketball Association (NBA) players to ever play the game did it without any hair on their heads. While others have retired, some are still actively playing. So, who are the famous bald NBA players of all time? Here is a detailed list of bald basketball players.

1. Kobe Bryant

Kobe Bryan was a famous bald basketball player from Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, USA. Kobe debuted in the National Basketball Association in 1996, rocking a bald look through shaving. However, between 1997 and 2011, he started losing his hair, so he chose to have a shaved look.

Kobe was a shooting guard for the Los Angeles Lakers throughout his two-decade of basketball. Before his death on 26th January 2020, he was regarded as among the greatest players and scorers.

Some of his key awards were:

NBA Most Valuable Player

4× NBA All-Star Game MVP

11× All-NBA First Team

2× All-NBA Second Team

9× NBA All-Defensive First Team

3× NBA All-Defensive Second Team

2× NBA scoring champion

NBA Slam Dunk Contest champion

2. Kareem Abdul Jabbar

Kareem Abdul Jabbar is a retired professional basketball player. He is also among the best bald NBA players of all time, as seen throughout his 20 seasons in the league. Early in his career as a college player, he had an eye-catching afro but opted to go bald.

Kareem played Milwaukee Bucks from 1969 to 1975 and Los Angeles Lakers from 1975 to 1989. He also served as a coach for Oklahoma Storm in 2002 and as an assistant coach for Alchesay High school from 1998 to 1999, Los Angeles Clippers in 2000, and for Los Angeles Lakers between 2005 and 2011.

His career is decorated with the following awards:

6× NBA Most Valuable Player

5× NBA All-Defensive First Team

6× NBA All-Defensive Second Team

NBA Rookie of the Year

NBA All-Rookie First Team

2× NBA scoring champion

NBA rebounding leader

4× NBA blocks leader

3. Michael Jordan

Michael Jordan is one of the bald NBA players in the west. However, the former NBA player is an acclaimed businessman too. Like other bald players, Michael Jordan went bald early in the 1990s. Throughout his career as a player, he has played for two teams, Chicago Bulls from 1984 to 1993 and 1995 to 1998 and Washington Wizards from 2001 to 2003.

Michael is one of the greatest players of all time, as seen in his career highlights and awards, such as:

Sports Illustrated Sportsperson of the Year

National college player of the year

2× Sporting News National Player of the Year

2× Consensus first-team All-American

No. 23 retired by North Carolina Tar Heels

2× USA Basketball Male Athlete of the Year

Presidential Medal of Freedom

4. Shaquille O’Neal

Shaquille Rashaun O’Neal is an American former basketball player and a sports analyst for Inside the NBA. He is also one of the NBA players who shave their heads. But, apart from being a recognizable bald head, he is one of the best players.

Throughout his close to two decades career in the National Basketball Association, he players for six teams, namely:

Orlando Magic

Los Angeles Lakers

Miami Heat

Phoenix Suns

Cleveland Cavaliers

Boston Celtics

He also has many awards, such as:

NBA Most Valuable Player

3× NBA All-Star Game MVP

8× All-NBA First Team

2× All-NBA Second Team

4× All-NBA Third Team

3× NBA All-Defensive Second Team

5. Alex Caruso

What current NBA players are bald? Alex Caruso is one of the bald players. He is a professional basketball player for Chicago Bulls. Nicknamed Bald Mamba, he completely went bald for a noble course. He shaved his head to raise $10,000 for testicular cancer research.

Throughout his career, he has played for four teams, namely:

2016 to 2017 – Oklahoma City Blue

2017 to 2021 – Los Angeles Laker

2017 to 2019 – South Bay Lakers

2021 to present – Chicago Bulls

Some of his recognized awards include the NBA Champion 2020.

6. Nicholas Batum

Nicholas Batum is one of the current bald NBA players from Lisieux, France. The professional basketball player is a small and power forward for the Los Angeles Clippers of the National Basketball Association (NBA). Unlike some players who rock bald after suffering hair loss, Batum sports the look by choice.

He has also played for other teams such as:

2006 to 2008 – Le Mans Sarthe

2008 to 2015 – Portland Trail Blazers

2015 to 2020 – Charlotte Hornets

2020 to the present – Los Angeles Clippers

Nicholas has bagged a couple of awards, such as:

2× LNB Pro A Best Young Player

French Basketball Player of the Year

Albert Schweitzer Tournament

FIBA Europe Under-18 Championship MVP

7. Gary Payton Sr

Gary Dwayne Payton Sr is an American former professional basketball from Oakland, California. The player went bald during his college days, and today, he is one of the most famous bald NBA players of all time. To this day, many consider him one of the greatest point guards ever.

Gary has played for various teams, such as:

1990 to 2003 – Seattle SuperSonics

2003 – Milwaukee Bucks

2003 to 2004 – Los Angeles Lakers

2004 to 2005 – Boston Celtics

2005 to 2007 – Miami Heat

The player has bagged many awards, such as:

NBA Defensive Player of the Year

Nine times NBA All-Defensive First Team

Pac-10 Player of the Year

No. 20 retired by Oregon State Beavers

USA Basketball Male Athlete of the Year

8. Jason Kidd

Jason Kidd is one of the bald guards in the NBA. He is an American professional basketball coach and a former San Francisco, California player. He has sported a shaved head throughout most of his career. Jason is regarded as one of the greatest passers and point guards ever.

He has played for teams such as:

1994 to 1996 – Dallas Mavericks

1996 to 2001 – Phoenix Suns

2001 to 2008 – New Jersey Nets

2008 to 2012 – Dallas Mavericks

2012 to 2013 – New York Celtics

As a coach, Jason has worked for the following:

2013 to 2014 – Brooklyn Nets

2014 to 2018 – Milwaukee Bucks

2019 to 2021 – Los Angeles Lakers as an assistant

2021 to the present Dallas Mavericks

9. Karl Malone

Karl Anthony Malone is a renowned bald former American professional basketball player from Summerfield, Louisiana. Basketball enthusiasts consider him one of the greatest power forwards in the National Basketball Association history.

He played for two teams, Uta Jazz from 1985 to 2003 and Los Angeles Lakers from 2003 to 2005. In addition, to playing, he worked as an assistant coach for Louisiana Tech Bulldogs from 2007 to 2011. Some of the awards he took home include:

2× NBA Most Valuable Player

14× NBA All-Star

2× NBA All-Star Game MVP

11× All-NBA First Team

2× All-NBA Second Team

3× NBA All-Defensive First Team

10. Chris Kaman

Chris Kaman is one of the bald NBA players with a beard. He is a retired German-American professional basketball player from Grand Rapids, Michigan. He started sporting a bald look a few years after joining basketball.

Chris played centre for various teams, including;

2003 to 2011 – Los Angeles Clippers

2011 to 2012 – New Orleans Hornets

2012 – 2013 – Dallas Mavericks

2013 – 2014 – Los Angeles Lakers

2014 to 2016 – Portland Trail Blazers

His career is decorated with several awards, such as:

EuroBasket rebounding leader

NBA All-Star

MAC Player of the Year

MAC tournament MVP

The National Basketball Association history is full of Hall of Fame players who went bald at some point in their eminent careers. Some went bald after retiring from their careers, while others joined the league with bald looks. Regardless, the best bald NBA players are honoured for their physical appearances and excellent performances on the court.

Tuko.co.ke shared an article about the hottest basketball players in the NBA. For a long time, the NBA has taken pride in being home to some of the most attractive players ever. They make fans turn in awe, thanks to their looks and excellent scores.

The hottest players didn’t achieve good looks overnight but by being always physically active during the matches and training. This, in turn, has given them some well-chiselled physiques envied by many. These players include Kelly Obure Jr, Ja Morant, Zach LaVine, Jalen Green, and Jaden Ivey.

Source: TUKO.co.ke
